contentList.content:
Affected entity has gained [1].

As long as it has its temporary hit points, its melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an additional [2], and it deals double damage with Halo of Spores.

Ends early if the entity uses Wild Shape.
It has a starting health of [1] that increases over levels up to its maximum of [2].
Track how many meters you have moved this turn.
You need to move at least 6m before using this ability
Depending on the intensity of the burning source, takes between [1] and [2] per turn.
You can make a Bite attack after a Claws attack
You can make a Claws attack right after a Bite attack
You can make a Bite attack after a Talons attack
Take the shape of a giant badger that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_GiantBadger_Wildshape">multi-attack</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a cat.

Take the shape of a spider:
Level 2: Giant Wolf Spider that can bite. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 8: Giant Spider Wolf that can bite and web. It has [3] Hit Points.
Target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking [1] poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Take the shape of a giant wolf spider that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_GiantWolfSpider_Wildshape">bite</LSTag>.
Bite a target and apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GIANT_WOLFSPIDER_POISON">poison</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a giant spider that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_GiantSpider_Wildshape">bite</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Web_GiantSpider_WildShape">web</LSTag>.
Bite a target and apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GIANT_SPIDER_POISON">poison</LSTag>.

Throw a web on a target. It is restrained by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GIANT_SPIDER_WEB_DC12">webbing</LSTag>. As an action, the restrained target can try to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_BurstWebbing_DC12">burst</LSTag> the webbing.
Burst the webbing with a successful Strength DC [1]

Take the shape of a saurus:
Level 2: Velociraptor that multi-attack. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 9: Ankylosaurus that can make a tail attack. It has between [3] and [4] Hit Points.
Level 12: Stegosaurus that can make a tail attack. It has [5] Hit Points.
Take the shape of a velociraptor that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Velociraptor_Wildshape">multi-attack</LSTag>.

Take the shape of a wolf:
Level 2: Wolf that can bite. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 8: Dire Wolf that can bite. It has [3] Hit Points.
Bite a target and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> on a failed Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a dire wolf that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_DireWolf_Wildshape">bite</LSTag>.
Bite a target and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> on a failed Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Take the shape of a feline:
Level 2: Panther that can bite and pounce. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 6: Sabre-Toothed Tiger that can bite and pounce. It has between [3] and [4] Hit Points.
Level 9: Spotted Lion that can rend. It has between [5] and [6] Hit Points.
If the target is prone, the [1] can make another attack against it as a bonus action
Take the shape of a panther that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Panther_WildShape">bite</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Pounce_Panther_WildShape">pounce</LSTag>.

Move at least 6m straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANTHER_POUNCE">Prone</LSTag> on a failed Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Take the shape of a sabre-toothed tiger that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_SaberToothTiger_Wildshape">bite</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Pounce_SaberToothTiger_Wildshape">pounce</LSTag>.

Move at least 6m straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WILDSHAPE_SABERTOOTHTIGER_POUNCE">Prone</LSTag> on a failed Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a spotted lion that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Rend_SpottedLion_Wildshape">rend</LSTag>.

Move at least 6m straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Rend attack on the same turn and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WILDSHAPE_SPOTTED_LION_REND">Prone</LSTag> on a failed Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a giant hyena that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Hyena_Wildshape">bite</LSTag> and go <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Rampage">Rampage</LSTag>.

Take the shape of a bear:
Level 4: Black Bear that can multi-attack. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 8: Brown Bear that can multi-attack. It has [3] Hit Points.

Take the shape of a bear:
Level 2: Brown Bear that can multi-attack. It has between [1] and [2] Hit Points.
Level 6: Polar Bear that can multi-attack. It has [3] Hit Points.
Take the shape of a black bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Bear_Black_Wildshape">multi-attack</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a brown bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Bear_Brown_Wildshape">multi-attack</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a polar bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Bear_Polar_Wildshape">multi-attack</LSTag>.

Take the shape of a giant elk that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Ram_GiantElk_Wildshape">ram</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Hoove_GiantElk_Wildshape">hooves</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Charge_GiantElk_Wildshape">charge</LSTag>.

Move at least [1] straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [2] damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Charge a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [1] damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone
Take the shape of a giant eagle that can fly [1] and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_GiantEagle_Wildshape">multiattack</LSTag>. It has [2].
Take the shape of a giant vulture that can fly [1] and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_GiantVulture_Wildshape">multiattack</LSTag>. It has [2].
Take the shape of a quetzalcoatlus that can fly [1] and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Quetzalcoatlus_Wildshape">bite</LSTag>. It has [2].
Bite a target. If the quetzalcoatlus flew least [1] toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra [2].

Take the shape of an air elemental that can fly [1], <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Elemental_Air">multiattack</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Whirlwind_Elemental_Air">whirlwind</LSTag>.
Each creature within [1] must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes [2] damage and is flung up [3] away from the elemental and knocked prone, taking [4].

Take the shape of an fire elemental that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Elemental_Fire">multiattack</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Enter_Creature_Space_Elemental_Fire">enter space</LSTag>.

The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes [1] and catches fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes [2] at the start of each of its turns.
The elemental sheds bright light in a [1] radius and dim light in an additional [2].
Whenever the elemental moves in water, it takes [1].
Take the shape of an earth elemental that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Elemental_Earth_Wildshape">multiattack</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a water elemental that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Multiattack_Elemental_Water_Wildshape">multiattack</LSTag>.
Can't grapple more than one target

The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. Target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes [1] bludgeoning damage. If it is large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.
Attempt a DC 14 Strength check to escape a grapple.
Movement speed reduced to 0 and take [1] each turn.
Release grappling when moving out of melee range.
Liquid surfaces don't slow you down.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.
Doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

When the attacker <LSTag Tooltip="Downed">downs</LSTag> another creature with a melee attack, it can use a bonus action to move up to half its <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> and make a bite attack.
Immune to conditions: Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Webbed, Unconscious.
